paragraphs.content: Chapter 18
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 18

paragraphs.content: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.

paragraphs.content: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.

paragraphs.content: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

paragraphs.content: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.

paragraphs.content: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.

paragraphs.content: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.

paragraphs.content: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.

paragraphs.content: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

paragraphs.content: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.

paragraphs.content: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

paragraphs.content: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.

paragraphs.content: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.

paragraphs.content: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.

paragraphs.content: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
paragraphs.contentHtml: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?

paragraphs.content: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

paragraphs.content: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

paragraphs.content: He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.

paragraphs.content: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.

paragraphs.content: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.

paragraphs.content: A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.

paragraphs.content: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

paragraphs.content: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: The poor useth entreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The poor useth entreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.

paragraphs.content: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
